Hey Dimitar,

Hopefully this should become more clear in the HyperNEAT manu=
al that is coming out within the next few days, but in the meantime:

The f=
ormat for running a command line experiment is this:

./Hypercube_NEAT -I (=
input parameters file) -O (output population file) -R (random seed)

All of=
 my parameter files are included in the package, so to run Checkers for exa=
mple, the syntax is:

./release/Hypercube_NEAT.exe -I ./data/CheckersExperi=
ment.dat -O CheckersOutputPopulation.xml -R 1000

for windows or:

./Hyperc=
ube_NEAT -I ./data/CheckersExperiment.dat -O CheckersOutputPopulation.xml -=
R 1000

for unix/mac

Jason G.


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "dimitar.nede=
v" <nedev.dimitar@...> wrote:
>
> Hi all,
> 
> After successfully compiling=
 HyperNEAT 2.6 I'm now trying to run a few experiments and as far as I unde=
rstand I need a configuration file in order to do it.
> 
> Can anyone pleas=
e help me with the right command line parameters (I'm unable to compile the=
 GUI) and provide me with a configuration file (or give me some explanation=
 how to make one myself).
> 
> I'd be very interested to get the configurat=
ion for some of the experiments described in the already published papers, =
so that I can use those results as baseline for comparison my own experimen=
ts on my machine.
> 
> Cheers,
> Dimitar
>
